## Chernobyl Disaster Simplified

On April 26, 1986, a nuclear reactor in Chernobyl, Ukraine exploded. This was the worst nuclear disaster in history. A test gone wrong caused a huge surge in power, melting the reactor and spreading radioactive material across Europe.

Thousands of people had to evacuate their homes. Many workers who tried to fix the damage got sick or died from radiation. The cleanup will take until 2065.  The disaster reminds us of the dangers of nuclear power.
